Localisation.value: results - change the Search Result Limit or try and be more specific!
This value is added to the current miles travelled in order to determine the next encounter roll.
Use negative values for a build time reduction - only applied to newly started constructions!
You have to restart the game for the changes to the Global Map Zoom Level to apply!
Best used together with Focus Camera
Custom items from the Craft Magic Items mod have to be crafted at least once before they show up in the search!
If you can't find a feat through the search try the Parametrized Feats option.
The values can be edited in the Experimental sub-menu.
Hours Worth Of Weariness Per Attempt
Attacks of opportunity targeting the selection will be prevented.
Type 'help' into the Smart Console to get a list of all console commands.

JSON files named after the AssetGUID of the item you wish to edit have to be placed inside of the ModifiedBlueprints folder (e.g. 'efa6c2ee9e630384188a50b1ce6600fe.json'. Some edits might require a game restart or manual patching (button below). Either remove values you don't want to change or set them to null. Example files for each supported category are included in the ModifiedBlueprints folder. The AsserGUIDs can be acquired from spacehamster's JSON Blueprint Dump on github or you can directly edit most values through the item search or this menu. Adding enchantments of the wrong type might cause display issues in the inventory!
The duration of creatures summoned by the selection will be multiplied by the selected value.
The duration of buffs cast by the selection will be multiplied by the selected value.
Creatures summoned by the selection will always be level 20.
Note that these settings are not the only parameters for random encounter chance calculation. The actual chances for the current region can be seen in the box above.
The mod can't be accessed from the main menu. Either load a save file or start a new character!
Please wait while the game loads.
No unit found - try a different setting!
The abilities will be added to the current spellbook at the selected spell level.
Requires you to reload the area (e.g. leave and enter again).
No region found! Try again further into the game or on the global map.
Maximal Base Ability Score At Character Creation
Minimal Base Ability Score At Character Creation
Hard Encounter Chance On Global Map
Chance When Camping After Attack During Rest
Search .csv files for Custom Item sets
Search .txt files for Custom Item sets
Remember open sub-menus and search settings
Create backup before importing character statistics
Add Abilities/Spells From Favourites As Spells
Add All Hand Simple (First World Lantern)
Add All Armour And Weapon Proficiencies To
Change Party Members (Only On Local Maps)
Activate New Party Members And Teleport To Player
Set Party's Current Hit Points To
Set Extra Primary Hand Attacks To
Set Extra Secondary Hand Attacks To
Set Creatures's Speed When Summoned To
All Map Locations Except Waypoints And Hidden Locations
Set Default Metamagic Cost To Zero
Set Party Speed To Fastest Member
Enable DLC Content (only if it is available on your system!)
Ignore Forbidden Feats When Choosing A Class
Search Only For Items Created By Craft Magic Items
Everyone Except The Player Faction Always Rolls 1
Always Be Able To Level Up
Add Full Hit Die Value On Level Up
Roll Hit Die Value On Level Up
Ignore Feat Prerequisites When Choosing A Class
Ignore Feat Prerequisites (List) When Choosing A Class
Enemies Don't Deal Damage To The Party
Party Members Kill Enemies In One Hit
Add Unity Mod Manager Button To ESC Menu
No Temporary Hit Point Reduction By Burn (Kineticist)
Close Unity Mod Manger Interface When Animations Plays
Set Maximal Dexterity Bonus Limit To 99
Neutral Alignment Shifts Don't Cause Movement On The Law/Chaos Axis
Ignore Spellbook And Ability Alignment Checks
Claim All Revealed Resources In Your Lands
Freeze Timed Quest At 90 Days Left
Allow Cooking And Hunting In Dungeons
Automatically Refill Consumables In Belt Solts
Ignore Caster Type And Spell Level Restrictions
Disable Warpainted Skull's Ability For Summoned Barbarians
Make sure to save before adding or removing unfamiliar buffs!
Make sure to save and create backups before using any of these options!
Both Party Always Rolls 20 and Take X are active! Party Always Rolls 20 will overwrite Take X's results!
Has to be disabled after spending the skill points in order to progress
The game might become unresponsive while adding the items!
This item causes errors and thus can't be added.
Be aware that too high values can break the Spellbook UI of prepared spellcasters!
is larger than the Upper Zoom Limit
As a result the scroll directions when zooming will be flipped!
In order to fix these you have to edit the party.json and remove any entries in m_selectionsByLevel entries beyond the first.
You can find an in depth guide on how to fix it on the mod page under Resources.
Can prevent low level characters from progressing past the spell selection.
You can use the button below to progress past it temporarily.
Does not disable the alignment restrictions for abilities and feats! Use Ignore Spellbook And Ability Alignment Checks to get around the ability/spellbook limitations (-> Spell & Ability Options)
It is recommended to keep Bag Of Tricks' XP Multiplier off while using ScaleXP!
Experimental Mode includes features that can break the game and cause crashes!
Make sure to save before adding or removing unfamiliar feats!
Adding too many weapon proficiencies may cause UI issues!
A character level above 20 will cause the spell book UI to break. You can use the Reset Character Level option to make it usable again.
Your experience points will be set to the lowest value for the chosen level!
If you are using the mod for the first time you can ignore this message.

Since there were major changes to the Settings.xml it is highly recommended to the delete the Settings.xml file in your 'Pathfinder Kingmaker\Mods\BagOfTricks' folder before continuing to use the mod!
Party Always Rolls 20 is active either disable it or Never Roll 1.
Party Always Rolls 20 is active either disable it or Never Roll 20.
This mod was created for game version
Save often and check the mod page and forum for information regarding compatibility!
Even when removed cantrips will still remain useable!
In order to use newly added spells you either have to rest or use
In order to use newly added spells you might either have to rest or use
Upgrading settlements through this menu won't count towards quest goals! A downgrade option is available in the experimental section (-> Misc).
Turning off random encounters completely will cause you to miss certain encounters required for quests and thus break them!
Can cause issues with summons, buffs and debuffs! To pause the kingdom timeline without any of these issues use the Kingdom Resolution mod.
The in-game Spellbook Screen can't display more than five spellbooks! Spellbooks added through this menu aren't fully functional (e.g. no cantrips)!
Combat related rolls made before combat has started are still affected by TakeX (e.g. an attack on an unsuspecting enemy).
Unlimited Casting is known to crash/freeze the game after the final fight of this scene. Thus it is highly recommended to deactivate it temporarily!
If you haven't cleared all combat encounters in this area is highly recommended to temporarily disable 'Enemies Don't Deal Damage To The Party' in this area! Otherwise a companion quest might break!

The duration of buffs cast by the selection will be multiplied by the selected value. Note that extremely high multipliers might prevent it from being applied to very long running buffs. If that is the case you will be able to see an error in the log (System.OverflowException).
Sets the encumbrance for individual characters and the party as a whole to the chosen value.
Use the input field to set the maximal ability score at character creation.
Use the input field to set the minimal ability score at character creation.
﻿Use the input field to set the ability points at character creation for the player.
﻿Use the input field to set the ability points at character creation for mercenaries.
Removes the halving of the hit die value by the game when adding hit point on level up.
Instead of adding half the hit die value every level up the added value is determined by a roll.
﻿Use the input field to set the caster level.
You can level up even when you don't meet the experience requirements or are already level 20. The UI indicators won't immediately update to show that a level up is available/unavailable.
﻿Ignore restrictions when picking classes and feats. If you pick a Prestige Class at character creation you will start without equipment and might lack important Weapon Proficiencies!
﻿Ignore caster type and spell level restrictions.
﻿Ignore forbidden feats when choosing a class e.g. Atheism when trying to become a Cleric.
Ignore feat prerequisites when choosing a class (e.g. allows to become a Cleric of Groetus). If this option doesn't work try Ignore Feat Prerequisites (List) When Choosing A Class
﻿Ignore feat prerequisites from lists when choosing a class. If this option doesn't work try Ignore Feat Prerequisites When Choosing A Class
Enables a multiplier for all gained experience points.
Use the slider to set a multiplier.
Allows to set a custom multiplier.
Teaches all cooking recipes to the party.
Applies all the effects of a rest immediately to the party.
Applies all the effects of a rest automatically after every combat.
Allows to hunt and cook during rests in dungeons.
Disables to need for rations when resting.
Adds six rations to the party's inventory.
Use the input field to set a multiplier for the cost for recruiting a mercenary.
Enables a multiplier for goods sold to vendors.
Locks can be picked repeatedly. Required for Lock Picking Causes Weariness and Use Lock Pick
Each attempt at picking a lock causes weariness. Below the value can be customized (1.0 = 1 hour of weariness per attempt).

This is a simple proof of concept of a lock pick system. Your party has a limited set of lock picks based on their Trickery. During rests (currently only camping) the party members skilled in Trickery will create new lock picks. The amount is based on skill rolls. If you use this feature please provide feedback!
Display the amount of lock picks in the inventory screen. Requires to load a save or change the area in order to take effect.
Requires to load a save or change the area in order to fully take effect.
Allows you to set a switch a character's gender. Causes visual glitches!
Allows to change the class level independent of leveling and to add normally unavailable classes. Save often and use with caution!
﻿Removes all equipped items from the selected character.
﻿Resets the character level to match your current experience points (at most level 20).
﻿Sets the character level to the chosen value.
Set the selected character's alignment to the one chosen from the selection grid. "You've performed a [x] action." will be displayed irregardless of the unit affected.
Shifts the selected character's alignment towards the one chosen from the selection grid by the set value.
Set the selected character's size to the one chosen from the selection grid.
Revert the selected character back to their original size.
Use the input field or the +/- buttons to alter the statistics.
Switch between displaying all skills or only class skills.
Use the slider to set a multiplier for the chosen party statistics.
Creates a .txt file with all the selected character's statistics in the Characters folder. This file can be edited and imported.
Imports all the statistics for the selected character from a .txt file.
The weight of all items is set to 0.
Sets the maximal Dexterity Bonus limit of all armours to 99.
Sets the Armour Check Penalty of all armours to 0.
Disables equipment restrictions (Alignment, Class, Statistics and Proficiencies).
Items added through this menu will be added in an identified state.
If you don't know an item's Guid you can use the search function below.
Allows you to insert multiple Guid separated by commas.
Display enemies instead of party members.
﻿Enabling this options will allow you to add versions of feats the game doesn't normally include e.g. Fencing Grace (Greatclub).
Restore your party's spells and abilities﻿. Does not affect Burn - use Instant Rest instead.
Disable alignment checks for spellbooks access and when using ability e.g. allowing you to use Paladin abilities while being Chaotic Evil.
﻿Disables arcane spell failure for your party.
﻿Prevents party members from failing casting defensively.
Prevents party members from failing concentration checks.
Sets the default Metamagic cost to zero.
﻿Allows spontaneous casters to copy spells from scrolls.
Unlimited ability uses for you party.
All spells and abilities are automatically restored after every combat.
All items are automatically recharged after every combat.
Disables friendly fire when using area off effect spells or abilities.
Disables friendly fire of any type.
Disables cooldowns (certain delays will still occur).
Disables cooldowns only for the main character (certain delays will still occur).
The Burn Cost is either completely removed or not applied.

Sets the accepted burn to its maximal value and keeps it at that value until deactivated. Changes to the burn maximum or party composition/new levels as Kineticist might require to toggle this option off and on or a rest.
Removes the temporary hit point reduction caused by burn. Requires you to return to the main menu and reload your save game!
Use the slider or a custom multiplier to set the amount of spells per day / memorised spells.
Swapping party members on the global map happens instantly.
Sets the speed of the whole party to match the speed of the fastest party member.
Multiplies the movement speed of all party members by the set value.
Claims all revealed resources in your lands. Note that the claims will still cost you BP!
Sets the cost for claiming resources to 0.
Teleport the party to the current mouse position with a key press (on foot and on the global map).
Teleports the party to the player character.
Use the input field to set a multiplier for the global map travel time scale.
Use the toggles, slider and input files to configure random encounter to your liking.
Disables random encounters on the global map.
Avoiding random encounters will always be successful.
Set the kingdom's alignment to the one chosen from the selection grid.
﻿﻿﻿Force success/triumph for the result of kingdom events.
Allows you to pick individual skills which will always pass when checked.
Sets the DC of all skill checks to -99.
Allows you to pick individual saving throws which will always pass when checked.
All attack performed by the party result in critical hits.
Every roll on a d20 by the main character will result in a natural 20.
Every roll on a d20 by the party will result in a natural 20.
Enable a hotkey to toggle Party Always Rolls 20.
Every roll on a d20 by the enemies will result in a natural 1.
Every roll on a d20 by anyone except the members of the player faction will result in a natural 1.
Rolls of 1 on a d20 never occur. Can be set to affect everyone, only the party or only enemies.
Rolls of 20 on a d20 never occur. Can be set to affect everyone, only the party or only enemies.
Two d20s are rolled instead of one and the highest one is taken as the result. Can be set to affect everyone, only the party or only enemies.
Two d20s are rolled instead of one and the lowest one is taken as the result. Can be set to affect everyone, only the party or only enemies.
﻿Everyone including your enemies rolls 20 for initiative.
﻿﻿D20 rolls made out of combat will result in the set value i.e. 10, 20 or a custom one.
Enables the option to change the scroll speed of the camera.
Enables editing the camera zoom limits.
Enables focusing the camera on party members and cycling through them via hotkey.
Selecting a character's portrait will cause the camera to focus on them.
Disables the camera bounds and allows you to free move the camera.
Centers the camera on the player character.
﻿﻿Allows you to move during cutscenes. Best used together with Focus Camera to override the game's focus.
Enables to toggle the Reset Cutscene Lock option via hotkey.
Closes the Unity Mod Manager interface once a play button is pressed.
Displays the current area's name at the top of the screen.
Displays the combat difficulty and CR once combat starts. If the development tools are enabled their combat difficulty display will be used instead. Disabling requires a restart to take effect!
﻿﻿Adds a button which opens the Unity Mod Manager UI to the ESC menu. Requires to load a save or change the area in order to take effect.
Adjusts the position of the button (0 = bottom, 6 = top). Requires to load a save or change the area in order to take effect.
E.g. when being Lawful Neutral a Neutral Good alignment shift will bring you towards Lawful Good instead of Neutral Good

The belt slots will automatically be refilled after an items is used. But only if another item of the same type is available in the party's inventory. Equipping an item (e.g. Alchemist's Fire) multiple times in the belt while also having them on the quick/action bar will cause 0 charge items to left behind if used from the belt.
Allows to view a pet's inventory by selecting it and pressing the inventory key.
Dynamically scales the size of the money display to fit larger amounts properly.
Sorts the spellbooks on the Spellbooks Screen alphabetically.
Sorts the spells on the Spellbooks Screen alphabetically.
Prevents party members from gaining negative levels. The game will still display level drain messages in the battle log.

Allows you to control summons summoned by party members. Only applies to those summoned after activating this option. If the summon duration runs out while a summon's movement order is in progress the green preview marker will remain visible.
Barbarians summoned by the Warpainted Skull of Duthica won't be able to use the Warpainted Skull of Duthica's ability themself.
Removes the permanent glow from summons. Does not apply to already summoned units.

Freezes the time left on timed quest at 90 days. Once turned off timed quest will return to their normal state i.e. they will react as if time has progressed while the option was active. Thus it is recommended to complete timed quest before turning it off or making sure that there is still time left.
﻿﻿The action key can be set to perform a range of actions via hotkey.
The selected group won't be the target of attacks of opportunity.
Multiplies the duration of summons by the chosen value.
Sets the level of all summons to 20.
All party members gain the set number of extra main attacks for the primary and secondary hand.
The speed of all creatures summoned by the party will be set to the chosen value. Does not apply to already summoned ones!
Changes the time scale of the whole game.
Stops the passing of time on local maps, on the global map and through actions (e.g. resting). Quest timers won't advance.
Enemies don't deal damage to the party.
Party members kill their target with a single blow (if they hit and are using the correct damage type).
Enables the setting of multipliers to the damage dealt by the party and enemies.
Enables damage dealt by the party multiplier.
Enables damage dealt by enemies multiplier.
They will still be display as if they were locked, but any character will be able to open them. This might grant you access to places you shouldn't be able to reach!
Experimental Mode includes features that can break the game and cause crashes!
Enables logging the gathered information to the BagOfTricks.log file in the BagOfTricks folder.
Displays a info box with unit statistics.
Allows to completely disable fog of war or only its visuals.
﻿﻿Reverses caster alignment checks e.g. when summoning monsters with an evil character you will summon the good variant.
﻿﻿Prevents any changes made to a character's alignment.

﻿Swaps the models of spiders with wolves and spider swarms with rat swarms. Note that this doesn't affect the small non-interactable spiders! A game restart/reload is highly recommended after changing the setting!
Enables the built-in development tools (e.g. console) and adds new commands. Requires a restart to fully take effect.
Writes all Smart Console logs to the Unity Mod Manger log.
Forwards UberLogger's messages to Unity's output log.
Adds [UberLogger] to the messages forwarded to Unity's output log.
Enables the modification of existing blueprints by loading files from the ModifiedBlueprints directory.
Enables toggling of the HUD via hotkey.
Displays an object's name and GUID when hovering your cursor over it.
The Tax Collector will collect build points and money (based on your character and kingdom stats) for you while you are gone.
﻿﻿Disables the display of tooltips by the mod.
﻿Disables in-game log messages created by the mod.
﻿Enables a scrollbar in the mod's menu allowing the category buttons to be visible at all time. Don't enable this if you have a lot of mods installed!
Creates a .xml file of the fallback localisation.
Spells are added to the Abilities Favourites
Click to move the element up or shift-click to move it to the top.
Click to move the element down or shift-click to move it to the bottom.
Set Armour Check Penalty To 0 will only be active outside of combat encounters. Unequipped items will always display an armour check penalty of 0.
No Arcane Spell Failure will only be active outside of combat encounters.
Requires a restart to fully take effect.
c5d4962385e0e9c439ab935d83361947 (EkunQ2_rewardArmor) causes errors and thus won't be added.
Or do you wish to be addressed differently?
Please tell me, how I shall address you in the future?
What do you wish to do?
